title.narrative: CHILD RIGHTS MONITORING

description.narrative: By 2020, ministerial and independent child rights monitoring mechanisms are reinforced, to identify violations and enable evidence - based policymaking and response,which contributes to Access To Justice, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Data And Child Protection, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, all children benefit from strengthened accountability for child rights implementation through the establishment of effective child rights monitoring mechanisms and improved access to justice

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Independent national child rights institution / ombudsperson
Justice, birth registration/CRVS, and alternative care - planning, co-ordination and programme monitoring

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, ministerial and independent child rights monitoring mechanisms are reinforced, to identify violations and enable evidence - based policymaking and response

description.narrative: With support from UNICEF, the Parliament Committee on Human Rights and Civil Integration developed a draft Code on the Rights of the Child which was adopted by Parliament in September 2019. Perspectives for a new partnership for the promotion of child rights appeared through an open dialogue with the Georgian Orthodox Church, the Administration of All Muslims of Georgia and other denominations on child rights and the benefits of the Child Rights Code. Independent and ministerial child rights monitoring mechanisms and capacities were further strengthened. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/12/2019

title.narrative: Accountability for child rights of Government of Georgia is strengthened through improved monitoring and reporting mechanisms

target.value: 2019:Child Rights Commission capacity to coordinate and monitor implementation of Child Rights Action Plan is strenghtened

actual.value: 2019:Capacity of the Inter Agency Council on the Implementation of the CRC was further strengthened. The Code on the Rights of the Child establishes and strengthens child rights implementation and monitoring mechanisms through the increased accountability of relevant state and non-state agencies, local

title.narrative: Accountability for child rights of Government of Georgia is strengthened through improved monitoring and reporting mechanisms

target.value: 2019:Child Rights Commission capacity to coordinate and monitor implementation of Child Rights Action Plan is strenghtened

actual.value: 2019:Capacity of the Inter Agency Council on the Implementation of the CRC was further strengthened. The Code on the Rights of the Child establishes and strengthens child rights implementation and monitoring mechanisms through the increased accountability of relevant state and non-state agencies, local

title.narrative: Accountability for child rights of Government of Georgia is strengthened through improved monitoring and reporting mechanisms

target.value: 2019:Child Rights Commission capacity to coordinate and monitor implementation of Child Rights Action Plan is strenghtened

actual.value: 2019:In Abkhazia, Georgia, UNICEF supported expansion of the social work pilot to all districts focusing on capacity building of social workers and development of cross-sectoral collaboration on child protection.

title.narrative: Accountability for child rights of Government of Georgia is strengthened through improved monitoring and reporting mechanisms

target.value: 2019:Child Rights Commission capacity to coordinate and monitor implementation of Child Rights Action Plan is strenghtened

actual.value: 2019:In Abkhazia, Georgia, UNICEF supported expansion of the social work pilot to all districts focusing on capacity building of social workers and development of cross-sectoral collaboration on child protection.

title.narrative: # of religious leaders trained (disaggregated by denomination)

target.value: 2020:Build the capacity of 125 religious leaders of 11 denominations on child rights

title.narrative: Existence of Ombudsmans Office, National Human Rights Institution, or a network of child rights civil society groups that are able to monitor and report on child rights violations

target.value: 2019:#of PDO and NGO representatives trained to conduct child rights monitoring

actual.value: 2019:Capacity of PDO Child Rights Department and regional offices (25 professionals in total) strengthened. Dialogue with NGOs initiated to strengthen independent CRM mechanism. Capacity of PDO CRD is strengthened to monitor pre-school institutions.

title.narrative: Religious leaders mobilized on the promotion and protection of child rights

baseline.value: In August 2019, UNICEF signed a Memorandum of Understanding with the State Agency on Religious Issues, which will allow expansion of the emerging partnership to all religious denominations in the coun

target.value: 2020:Declaration on the role of religious leaders in the promotion and protection of child rights signed and a report published on child rights with the compiled views of different religious denominations

title.narrative: Integrate/mainstream child and adolescent rights as priority to accelerate progress towards the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) in Georgia

target.value: 2019:Support the development of the Code on the Rights of the Child as a means to advance the SDGs

actual.value: 2019:The Code on the Rights of the Child was adopted on 20 September 2019 and brought Georgian legislation in line with international standards. This will help the country accelerate progress towards the SDGs.

title.narrative: Strategy on private sector partnerships and child rights in business principles developed

target.value: 2020:A draft strategy on private sector partnerships and child rights in business principles in Georgia available

title.narrative: Establish a Child Rights Center with educational resources in Akaki Tsereteli State University (ATSU)

target.value: 2020:Open and equip the first Child Rights Centre in academia in Akaki Tsereteli State University (ATSU) by the start of the 2020-2021 academic year

title.narrative: # of MoUs signed on child rights with CSOs

target.value: 2020:Sign at least 2 MoU on partnership in child rights with civil society partners

title.narrative: Strengthen child rights in university education

baseline.value: UNICEF established a new partnership with state universities by facilitating capacity development sessions on child rights with university professors. UNICEF supported three universities to adopt chil

target.value: 2020:Train 50 academic staff on incorporation of child rights into university education curricula and conduct first national conference on the incorporation of child rights into university education
